properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Accumulating snowfall expected. Total snowfall: 7 to 14 cm. Locations: western Newfoundland. Time span: tonight until morning on Christmas Eve. Remarks: Snow has begun in the Port aux Basques area and will spread northward to reach Bay St. George and the Bay of Islands by midnight. The snow will ease during the morning on Christmas Eve. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-12-24T16:59:39-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-12-24T02:07:39-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1338960941.2019
Area: Channel-Port aux Basques and vicinity, Corner Brook and vicinity, Bay St. George
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snow Squall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow squalls are expected. Under the snow squall bands, visibilities will be significantly reduced due to the heavy snow combined with blowing snow, and snow will quickly accumulate. Snow squalls will develop this morning and continue this afternoon and tonight Total snowfall: locally 20 to 40 cm. Maximum wind gusts: 60 to 80 km/h causing blowing snow. Locations: Victoria county and Inverness county north of Mabou, especially over the Highlands. Time span: today and tonight with conditions improving early Christmas morning. Remarks: Flurries heavy at times will develop this morning, with frequent snow squall activity as cold northwesterly winds strengthen. ### Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Snow squall warnings are issued when bands of snow form that produce intense accumulating snow or near zero visibilities. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2019-12-25T01:14:21-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-12-24T09:15:21-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4205248168.2019
Area: Inverness County - Mabou and north, Victoria County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Wind chill values near minus 50 are expected again tonight. ### Extreme cold puts everyone at risk. Extreme cold warnings are issued when very cold temperatures or wind chill creates an elevated risk to health such as frost bite and hypothermia. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather in British Columbia or Yukon, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm or #YTStorm.
Expires: 2019-12-25T02:32:57-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-12-24T10:33:57-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1520955997.2019
Area: Old Crow
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Very large waves, pounding surf and elevated sea water levels are expected later this week. Wave heights: 7 to 9 metres, breaking upon approach to shore. Locations: east and northeast coasts of Newfoundland. Time span: Thursday and Friday. Remarks: a prolonged period of strong winds will cause very large waves to build later this week. Storm surge and coastal flooding may occur along shorelines exposed to the north and northeast, especially near the high tides. The highest water levels are expected to occur on Friday morning, but vulnerable areas may become susceptible to flooding as early as the Thursday morning high tide. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-12-25T00:58:00-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-12-24T08:59:00-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1509772771.2019
Area: Avalon Peninsula North, St. John's and vicinity, Bay of Exploits, Bonavista North, Bonavista Peninsula, Clarenville and vicinity, Green Bay - White Bay, Terra Nova
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 10 to 20 cm is expected. Locations: south coast of Newfoundland from Burgeo to Francois. Time span: continuing until Christmas Eve morning. Remarks: scattered flurries will transition to snow, at times heavy, by midnight. Snowfall rates will begin to ease again in the morning. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-12-24T13:59:20-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-12-24T02:09:20-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2679383007.2019
Area: Burgeo - Ramea
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A prolonged period of hazardous winter conditions is expected. Total snowfall: 30 to 40 cm. Maximum wind gusts: northwesterly 80 km/h. Time span: this morning until Boxing Day night. Locations: Gander and northeastern Newfoundland. Remarks: Snow, at times heavy, will begin this morning and continue into tonight. The snow will become lighter and more intermittent on Christmas Day, before a second round of heavy snow sets in by the morning of Boxing Day. Gusty northeasterly winds will develop tonight and strengthen to strong northwesterlies with gusts to 80 km/h overnight. The strong northwesterlies will then persist through Boxing Day. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Winter storm warnings are issued when multiple types of severe winter weather are expected to occur together. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-12-25T01:11:25-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-12-24T09:12:25-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1280714473.2019
Area: Bay of Exploits, Bonavista North, Gander and vicinity, Terra Nova
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Fog Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Near zero visibility in fog is expected or occurring. ### Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility in some locations. Fog advisories are issued when near zero visibilities in fog are expected or occurring. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A prolonged period of hazardous winter conditions is expected. Total snowfall: 20 to 30 cm. Maximum wind gusts: northwesterly 70 km/h. Time span: this morning until Boxing Day. Locations: Grand Falls-Windsor to the Baie Verte Peninsula. Remarks: Light snow will transitions to snow, at times heavy, this morning and continue into tonight. Gusty northeasterly winds will also develop later today and will strengthen to strong northwesterlies with gusts to 70 km/h overnight tonight. Snow will become lighter and more intermittent for Christmas Day and Boxing Day, but the strong northwesterly winds will persist, resulting in poor visibility in blowing snow. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Winter storm warnings are issued when multiple types of severe winter weather are expected to occur together. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-12-25T01:07:03-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-12-24T09:08:03-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0821136032.2019
Area: Grand Falls-Windsor and vicinity, Green Bay - White Bay
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:

Remarks: The snow will begin to ease around noon. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.

Area: Burin Peninsula, Connaigre
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 15 to 25 cm is expected. Locations: southern Avalon Peninsula. Time span: early this morning until late tonight. Remarks: Snow, at times heavy, will begin early this morning and continue into tonight. The snow may also mix with rain at times over extreme southern areas. In addition, strong northwesterly winds will develop tonight resulting in areas of blowing snow. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-12-25T02:52:33-00:00

Areas of significantly reduced visibilities in fog are being reported throughout western and central Saskatchewan. Visibilities will gradually improve later this morning. ### Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Fog advisories are issued when near zero visibilities in fog are expected or occurring. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Heavy snowfall with blowing snow is expected. Total snowfall: 20 to 30 cm by Christmas Day morning. Maximum wind gusts: northwesterly 80 km/h. Time span: this morning until late Christmas Eve night. Remarks: Snow, at times heavy, will begin this morning and continue much of the night tonight. Strong easterly winds gusting to 60 km/h will develop during the afternoon and further increase to strong northwesterlies gusting to 80 km/h tonight. While the snow will ease overnight tonight, strong northwesterly winds will persist through Christmas Day and Boxing Day, causing blowing snow at times. In addition, a second round of steadier snow, possibly heavy, is expected to develop by afternoon on Boxing Day. Further details on accumulations for this period will be provided as more information becomes available. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Winter storm warnings are issued when multiple types of severe winter weather are expected to occur together. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-12-25T01:08:12-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-12-24T09:09:12-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2928768985.2019
Area: Avalon Peninsula North, St. John's and vicinity, Bonavista Peninsula, Clarenville and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with gusty winds and visibility frequently near zero in snow and blowing snow are expected or occurring. A blizzard is expected to develop over the Dempster highway Tuesday night. Fresh snow and winds gusting to 110 km/h will create near white out conditions through Tuesday night and Wednesday. Temperatures are also expected to be below minus 30C with windchill at times near minus 50, ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather in British Columbia or Yukon, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm or #YTStorm.
Expires: 2019-12-24T16:24:02-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-12-24T00:25:02-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2767925835.2019
Area: Dempster
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snow Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Persistent snow squalls are expected to develop. Under the snow squall bands, visibilities will be significantly reduced due to the heavy snow combined with blowing snow, and snow will quickly accumulate. Snow squalls are possible today and tonight. Total snowfall: locally 10 to 15 cm. Maximum wind gusts: 70 km/h causing some blowing snow. Locations: Pictou, Antigonish and Inverness county south of Mabou. Time span: today and tonight. Remarks: Flurries heavy at times will develop this morning, with areas of snow squall activity possible as cold northwesterly winds strengthen. ### Travel may be hazardous due to sudden changes in the weather. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Snow squall watches are issued when conditions are favourable for the formation of bands of snow that could produce intense accumulating snow or near zero visibilities. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2019-12-25T01:18:28-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-12-24T09:19:28-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2564107326.2019
Area: Pictou County, Antigonish County, Inverness County - south of Mabou
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of about 15 cm is expected. A cold front approaching the BC north coast will bring heavy snow to the Stewart area tonight. Snowfall intensity will increase this evening as the front crosses the north coast. Snow accumulations of 15 cm can be expected by Tuesday morning. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2019-12-24T15:58:22-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-12-23T23:59:22-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1283867528.2019
Area: North Coast - inland including Stewart
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 15 to 20 cm continues. Locations: Deer Lake to Buchans and the interior. Total amounts: 15 to 20 cm. Time span: continuing until this afternoon. Remarks: Snow, at times heavy, will begin to ease this afternoon. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-12-24T20:59:06-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-12-24T09:07:06-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0714269218.2019
Area: Deer Lake - Humber Valley, Buchans and the interior
properties.Author: Environment Canada
